name: SHIFT (itch) (Furtive Art)
description:
IMPORTANT! The WebGl is currently not Working on Firefox, if you want to play on the web version use Chrome!!

Introduction

SHIFT is a game inspired by Gabriele Cirulli's popular game 2048, but with one major difference, moving in the same direction repeatedly causes the blocks leaning against the wall to SHIFT to the other side of the board.

This was done in an attempt to discourage a popular strategy of the original 2048, where players would try to keep the higher blocks in a corner, as it would prevent situations where you can't combine blocks with the same number because they are other blocks in the way.

While the game is still fun even with this strategy, I always found the game to be more enjoyable when playing with a scrambled board and specially the feeling you get when you manage to fix it.

My solution to that was to teleport the blocks to the other side, this causes them to be scrambled but also gives the perceptive players many more chances to get separated blocks back together.

This is my first published game, outside a game Jam, I have been wanting to publish something for a while to get a feel for it and thought something simple would be a good start

I also have plans to publish this on Android, so you may want to follow me here or on Twitter if you want to wait for the announcement.

I hope you enjoy my little game.

How to Play
  1. Use WASD or the Arrow Keys you can move all blocks and the SHIFT indicator in that direction.
  2. Imputing the same direction will cause the 4 blocks on the highlighted edge to SHIFT to the other side. A normal move will then be executed afterward.
  3. You can only change the SHIFT direction can only be done on valid moves.
  4. It is possible to Undo moves indefinably with E, but doing so mark your score, and prevent a "Clean" Victory.
  5. The game tracks "Clean" and "Unclean" high scores separately.
  6. The game can be restarted with R by pressing the buttons on screen.
Languages

The game currently has 2 languages. I will add more if possible.

  • Portuguese
